001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.util.Comparator;
004import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
005import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.NavigableMap;
008import java.util.NavigableSet;
009import java.util.Objects;
010import java.util.SequencedMap;
011import java.util.SequencedSet;
012import java.util.TreeMap;
013import java.util.TreeSet;
014import java.util.function.Function;
015import java.util.stream.Collector;
016import java.util.stream.Collectors;
017
018/**
019 * A factory of {@link Collector}s that allows to collect the stream of values into linked or sorted sets
020 * and the stream of {@link Map.Entry entries} into the linked or the sorted map.
021 * An enumeration {@link MergeFunction} could be used to handle the entries with the same {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key}.
022 */
023public class CoreCollectors {
024
025    /**
026     * The same as {@link Collectors#toCollection}, but produces {@link LinkedHashSet}.
027     *
028     * @return a {@code Collector} which collects all the input elements into a {@link LinkedHashSet}.
029     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect
030     */
031    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, SequencedSet<T>> toLinkedSet() {
032        return Collectors.toCollection(LinkedHashSet::new);
033    }
034
035    /**
036     * The same as {@link Collectors#toCollection}, but produces {@link TreeSet}.
037     *
038     * @return a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeSet}
039     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect (must implement {@link Comparable})
040     */
041    public static <T extends Comparable<T>> Collector<T, ?, NavigableSet<T>> toSortedSet() {
042        return Collectors.toCollection(TreeSet::new);
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * The same as {@link #toSortedSet()}, but with {@code comparator} as parameter
047     *
048     * @param comparator a function to compare the elements
049     * @return  a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeSet}
050     * @param <T> the type of the elements in stream to collect (not necessary to implement {@link Comparable})
051     */
052    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, NavigableSet<T>>
053    toSortedSet(Comparator<T> comparator) {
054        return Collectors.toCollection(() -> new TreeSet<>(Objects.requireNonNull(comparator)));
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap}, but the elements of collecting stream are required to be
059     * of type {@link Map.Entry}, and the produced sorted-map accepts them one by one like
060     * if the method {@link Map#putAll} would be invoked (the latest entries overwrite the existing ones).
061     *
062     * @return a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeMap}
063     * @param <K> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
064     * @param <U> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
065     */
066    public static <K, U>
067    Collector<Map.Entry<K,U>, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
068    toSortedMap() {
069        return toSortedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, Map.Entry::getValue);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * The same as {@link #toSortedMap()}, but the parameter {@code valueMapper} allows to transform
074     * <b>the whole input entry</b> of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;K,U&gt;}
075     * into <b>the value of output entry</b> of type {@link Map.Entry Map.Entry&lt;K,U&gt;},
076     * and the {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} of input entry remains the same in output one.
077     *
078     * @param valueMapper the function to transform the {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value}
079     * @return a {@link Collector}, which collects all the input elements into a {@link TreeMap}
080     * @param <K> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input and output streams
081     * @param <V> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in output stream
082     * @param <U> the type of {@link Map.Entry#getValue() value} for {@link Map.Entry entries} in input stream
083     */
084    public static <K, V, U>
085    Collector<Map.Entry<K, V>, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
086    toSortedMap(Function<Map.Entry<K, V>, U> valueMapper) {
087        return toSortedMap(Map.Entry::getKey, valueMapper);
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap}, but produces {@link TreeMap} with overwriting the duplicates.
092     *
093     * @param keyMapper a <i>key-mapping</i> function to produce keys
094     * @param valueMapper a <i>value-mapping</i> function to produce values
095     * @return a @{link Collector} which collects elements into a @{link Map}
096     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
097     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
098     * equal to the key and overwriting the existing values with new ones
099     * (according to {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE enum-value OVERWRITE}).
100     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
101     * @param <K> the output type of the key mapping function
102     * @param <U> the output type of the value mapping function
103     */
104    public static <T, K, U>
105    Collector<T, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
106    toSortedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
107                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper) {
108        return toSortedMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, MergeFunction.OVERWRITE);
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * The same as {@link #toSortedMap(Function, Function)},
113     * but allows to handle duplicates with {@link MergeFunction mergeFunction} parameter.
114     *
115     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
116     * @param <K> the output type of the key mapping function
117     * @param <U> the output type of the value mapping function
118     * @param keyMapper a mapping function to produce keys
119     * @param valueMapper a mapping function to produce values
120     * @param mergeFunction one of values that are represented by {@link MergeFunction}-enum
121     * @return a {@link Collector} which collects elements into a {@link NavigableMap}
122     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
123     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
124     * equal to the key and combining them using the {@code mergeFunction}.
125     */
126    public static <T, K, U>
127    Collector<T, ?, NavigableMap<K,U>>
128    toSortedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
129                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper,
130                MergeFunction mergeFunction) {
131        return Collectors.toMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, mergeFunction.op(), TreeMap::new);
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * The same as {@link Collectors#toMap}, but produces {@link LinkedHashMap} with overwriting the duplicates.
136     *
137     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
138     * @param <K> the output type of the key mapping function
139     * @param <U> the output type of the value mapping function
140     * @param keyMapper a <i>key-mapping</i> function to produce keys
141     * @param valueMapper a <i>value-mapping</i> function to produce values
142     * @return a {@link Collector} which collects elements into a {@link SequencedMap}
143     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
144     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
145     * equal to the key and overwriting the existing values with new ones
146     * (according to {@link MergeFunction#OVERWRITE enum-value OVERWRITE}).
147     */
148    public static <T, K, U>
149    Collector<T, ?, SequencedMap<K,U>>
150    toLinkedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
151                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper) {
152        return toLinkedMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, MergeFunction.OVERWRITE);
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * The same as {@link #toLinkedMap(Function, Function)},
157     * but allows to handle duplicates with {@link MergeFunction mergeFunction} parameter.
158     *
159     * @param <T> the type of the input elements
160     * @param <K> the output type of the key mapping function
161     * @param <U> the output type of the value mapping function
162     * @param keyMapper a mapping function to produce keys
163     * @param valueMapper a mapping function to produce values
164     * @param mergeFunction one of values that are represented by {@link MergeFunction}-enum
165     * @return a {@link Collector} which collects elements into a {@link SequencedMap},
166     * whose keys are the result of applying a {@code keyMapper} function to the input elements,
167     * and whose values are the result of applying a {@code valueMapper} function to all input elements
168     * equal to the key and combining them using the {@code mergeFunction}.
169     */
170    public static <T, K, U>
171    Collector<T, ?, SequencedMap<K,U>>
172    toLinkedMap(Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
173                Function<? super T, ? extends U> valueMapper,
174                MergeFunction mergeFunction) {
175        return Collectors.toMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, mergeFunction.op(), LinkedHashMap::new);
176    }
177
178    // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
179
180    private CoreCollectors() {
181        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
182        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
183    }
184}
